titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Albin Russmann photographs of Brooklyn 2007.039
titlestmt.author: John Zarrillo

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 11:19:22 +0000.

did.abstract: The collection consists of eight small photo albums containing 92 3" x 4 1/2" black and white prints and corresponding negatives, dating from 1951 to 1963. The photographs were taken by Albin Russmann, and document the Brooklyn neighborhoods of Bay Ridge and Downtown Brooklyn, as well as the Brooklyn Botanic Garden. Three of the albums document the construction of the St. Anselm Roman Catholic Church in Bay Ridge (1953-1962), and one album documents the construction of the Verrazano-Narrows Bridge (1961-1963).

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Photographs will enter the public domain in 2045.
